attributes.PROJECT_FULL_TITLE: Hydrogen interconnector between Sweden, Finland and Germany [currently known as the Baltic Sea Hydrogen Collector]
attributes.TECHNICAL_DESCR:
Baltic Sea Hydrogen Collector (BHC) is a cross-border infrastructure project connecting hydrogen production facilities onshore and offshore in Sweden, Finland and the Baltic Sea region with hydrogen offtake in Germany.
The project aims to develop two parallel pipeline strands totalling 2,206 km (2 x 168 km on the Swedish side, connecting Sweden with Åland, 2 x 80 km connecting Finland with Åland, 2 x 855 km connecting Åland with the German side) as a 100% hydrogen infrastructure composed of new offshore pipelines between Sweden, Finland and Germany.

The project includes, on the Swedish section:
• New 168 km parallel strand (total of 336 km) from the Swedish starting point to Åland.
On the Finnish section:
• New 80 km parallel strand (total of 160 km) from the Finnish starting point to Åland.
On the offshore section to Germany:
• New 855 km parallel strand (total of 1,710 km) from Åland to Lubmin.
• New offshore pipeline from a diversion point in the Baltic Sea to Gotland and Bornholm; the maritime routes are currently under development.
The hydrogen supply potential is ~5.4 Mt/y by 2040.
Details provided above reflect the planning status by April 2024. They may be revised in the following months.
attributes.IMPLEMENTATION_STATUS_DESCR: Planned but not yet in permitting
attributes.PROMOTERS: Gasgrid Finland Oy ; Nordion Energi AB
